borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions: <p>The proposal, by reason of siting,&nbsp;scale and design, would be an undesirable addition which would cause unacceptable overshadowing, loss of daylight and outlook and an overbearing impact to neighbouring dwellings. This would result in a harmful impact to the amenity currently enjoyed by neighbouring occupiers. As such, it fails to protect residential amenity and constitutes un-neighbourly development. The proposal thus fails to accord with the following policies which seek to ensure that development proposals protect residential amenity:</p><p>Paragraph 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF) (DLUHC, 2021)</p><p>Policy D6 of the London Plan (March 2021)</p><p>Policies BP8 and BP11 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011)</p><p>Sections 4.2 and 5.3 of the Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012)</p><p>Policies DMD1 and DMD6 of The London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021)</p>

<p>The proposal, by reason of scale, siting, bulk and design, would be an undesirable addition which would fail to appear subservient to the original dwelling and comprises overdevelopment of the plot. As such, the proposal fails to respect or reflect the character and appearance of the original dwelling, semi-detached pair and local area, causing harm to each of these. The proposal thus fails to accord with the following policies which seek to ensure that development proposals are well designed and respect and reflect existing character:</p><p>Paragraph 130 of the National Planning Policy Framework National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF) (DLUHC, 2021)</p><p>Policy D4 of the London Plan (March 2021)</p><p>Policies CP2 and CP3 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010)</p><p>Policies BP8 and BP11 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011)</p><p>Sections 4.1 and 5.4 of the Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012)</p><p>Policies SP2 and DMD6 of The London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021)</p>
description: Construction of a single storey rear conservatory
